name: weekly
comment: Common rules : If symptoms = $Q1 hay any response except [No symptom]

questions.title: Have you had any of the following symptoms since your last visit (or in the past week, if this is your first visit)?
rules: item [No symptoms] is exclusive with others

- If report any symptoms, check database: was the participant STILL ILL when they last completed the Weekly survey (i.e. they said “I am still ill” in response to Weekly Q4 below last time?) AND have fewer than 15 days elapsed since they last completed the Weekly Survey AND fewer than 15 days have elapsed since their previous date of symptom onset
- If Yes: continue with Weekly Q2
- If No or Don’t know: then treat this as a “new” bout of illness, continue with Weekly Q3
- Of course, this only applies to people who have previously participated
description: Why are we asking this?
The key part of this survey is tracking people’s symptoms.
How should I answer it?
For people with chronic (long-term)  illnesses, only tick changes in symptoms. So, if you have chronic shortness of breath (for instance)  then only tick this box if this has got worse recently.

questions.title: On DATE OF LAST VISIT you reported that you were still ill with symptoms that began on DATE OF FIRST SYMPTOMS REPORTED PREVIOUSLY. Are the symptoms you reported today part of the same bout of illness?
rules: Shown if If the participant was STILL ILL on their last visit and has reported symptoms this time
The “don’t know” option here might not apply to people filling it in for themselves but is relevant for people managing accounts for other people.
This means that the current symptoms are the start of a “new” illness: continue with Weekly $Q3

This means that the current symptoms are the continuation of the same bout of illness as the previous visit. The remainder of the symptoms questionnaire (onset date, further details about symptoms, details about seeking medical attention, treatment, time off work/school) can be pre-filled with their previous answers.
The point of the pre-filling is to make the survey quicker and easier for participants who have longer-duration symptoms.
description: Why are we asking this?
To make filling out the rest of the survey quicker for you.
How should I answer it?
If you believe that the symptoms you have reported today are caused by the same bout of illness as your previous symptoms, please tick “yes”.

To save you time, we have filled in the information you gave us previously about your illness. Please check that it is still correct, and make any changes – for instance, if you have visited a doctor or taken additional time off work since you last completed the survey.

questions.title: In the 14 days before your symptoms started, did you travel to an area at risk for new coronavirus infection?
In which area(s) at risk of infection did you go within 14 days before the onset of your symptoms?
In the 14 days before the onset of your symptoms, have you been in contact with one or more people who have stayed in an area at risk of infection with the new coronavirus?
In which area(s) at risk of infection with the new coronavirus these people have been?
In the 14 days before your symptoms started, have you been in close contact with someone for whom a PCR test (nasal swab) has confirmed that they have Covid-19?
rules: Shown (if symptoms ($Q1 != {0') AND (if answers to Q2 weekly other than « Yes »)

questions.title: Do you live in the same household as that person?
In the 14 days before your symptoms started, have you been in close contact with someone presenting symptoms of COVID-19?
description: Symptoms of COVID-19 include: fever or chills, cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, sore muscles and headache.

questions.title: Do you live in the same household as that person?
When did the first symptoms appear?
description: Why are we asking this?
To help us work out the number of cases of COVID-19 and flu that arise each day.
How should I answer it?
Please give as accurate an estimate as possible.

questions.title: When did your symptoms end?
description: Why are we asking this?
Using the beginning and end dates of symptoms we can work out how long respiratory infections last.
How should I answer it?
Please give as accurate an estimate as possible.

questions.title: Did your symptoms develop suddenly over a few hours?
description: Why are we asking this?
Sudden onset of symptoms is believed to be common for COVID-19 and flu.
How should I answer it?
Tick yes if your symptoms appeared over a few hours rather than gradually developing over a few days.

questions.title: When did your fever begin?
description: Why are we asking this?
Fever is very important for diagnosing COVID-19 and flu, so we want to know when this started.
How should I answer it?
Please give as accurate an estimate as possible.

questions.title: Did your fever develop suddenly over a few hours?
description: Why are we asking this?
COVID-19 and flu are often associated with a sudden onset of fever
How should I answer it?
Tick yes if your fever appeared over a few hours rather than gradually developing over a few days.

questions.title: Did you take your temperature?
description: Why are we asking this?
COVID-19 and flu often cause a high temperature. However, not everyone takes their temperature when they are ill.
How should I answer it?
Answer yes, if you took your temperature using a thermometer.

questions.title: What was your highest temperature measured?
description: Why are we asking this?
COVID-19 and flu often cause a high temperature.
How should I answer it?
Give the highest temperature you recorded during this episode of illness.

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, did you VISIT (see face to face) any of medical services?

option_4.text: Hospital accident & emergency department/out of hours service

option_6.text: No, but I have an appointment scheduled

comment: Will need to be adjusted to suit different countries.
description: Why are we asking this?
To find out whether people contact the health services because of their symptoms.
How should I answer it?
Tick all of those that apply. If you are due to see attend, then tick the final option.

questions.title: How soon after your symptoms appeared did you first visit this medical service?
rules: This should be asked for each option ticked in the previous question $Q7 (exept “No” or “Not yet”)

Table for each entry in the previous question. And then drop-down within each cell for the delays. Last year we had it as a table of radio boxes, but it displayed the same table no matter which options were chosen in Weekly Q7 – it would be nice if it only displayed the options selected in Weekly Q7
description: Why are we asking this?
To find out how quickly people with symptoms are seen by the health services.
How should I answer it?
Only record the time until your FIRST contact with the health services.

row_3.text: Hospital accident & emergency department/out of hours service

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, did you contact via TELEPHONE or INTERNET any of medical services?

option_3.text: GP - spoke to the doctor or nurse

questions.comment: This is the UK version. Will need to be adjusted to suit different countries.
description: Why are we asking this?
To find out whether people contact the health services because of their symptoms.
How should I answer it?
Tick all options that apply

questions.title: How soon after your symptoms appeared did you first contact via telephone or internet this medical service?
rules: This should be asked for each option ticked in the previous question (except [No]) Preferably, it only displays the options selected in Weekly Q8.

questions.title: What is the main reason for which you did not contact any health professional for the symptoms you declared today?

option_4.text: I think I know what I have and I use self-medication

option_5.text: I think there is no effective treatment for the disease I have

option_6.text: It is too hard to get an appointment quickly

option_9.text: For fear of consequences if the doctor thinks I have COVID-19

option_11.text: I don’t know/don’t want to answer

questions.title: Can you specify which consequences you mainly fear?

option_1.text: Have to do a diagnostic test

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, did you call [write the COVID-19 emergency line of your country]?
Because of your symptoms, did you call [EMERGENCY NUMBER FOR YOUR COUNTRY]?
Because of your symptoms, did you wear a mask (surgical mask sold in pharmacies)?

option_2.text: No, I would have liked but could not find any

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, did you undergo analyses to know if you have COVID-19 (infection due to SRAS-CoV-2)?

option_1.text: Yes, a PCR test (virus search, on a swab in nose or mouth, or a sputum or saliva sample)

option_2.text: Yes, a serological analysis (screening for antibodies against this virus, from a drop of blood at fingertip or a blood sample)

option_5.text: Yes, a rapid antigen detection test (on a swab in nose or mouth, with a result available in less than an hour)

option_3.text: Not yet, I plan to shortly undergo a test

option_4.text: No, I have a prescription but will not undergo a test

questions.comment: (the participant can select the first and second option together if he wants)
rules: Options {1} and {2} are exclusive to the others

questions.title: Do you already get the result of this PCR test?

option_1.text: Yes, Positive for this new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19)

option_2.text: Yes, Negative for this new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19)

option_3.text: Yes, the result is non interpretable

option_4.text: No, I do not have the result yet

questions.title: Do you already get the result of this serological analysis?

option_1.text: Yes, Positive for this new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19)

option_2.text: Yes, Negative for this new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19)

option_3.text: Yes, the result is non interpretable

option_4.text: No, I do not have the result yet

questions.title: How much time passed between the beginning of your symptoms and your search of a laboratory which could undergo this analysis?

option_1.text: Symptoms appeared the day or the day before the search of a laboratory

option_2.text: Symptoms appeared 2, 3 or 4 days before the search of a laboratory

option_3.text: Symptoms appeared 5, 6 or 7 days before the search of a laboratory

option_4.text: Symptoms appeared between 8 and 14 days before the search of a laboratory

option_5.text: Symptoms appeared between 15 and 28 days before the search of a laboratory

option_6.text: Symptoms appeared more than four weeks before the search of a laboratory

option_7.text: I don’t know/don’t want to answer

questions.title: How much time passed between the beginning of your symptoms and the sampling?

1_day.text: Symptoms appeared the day or the day before the sampling

2_4days.text: Symptoms appeared 2, 3 or 4 days before the sampling

5_7days.text: Symptoms appeared 5, 6 or 7 days before the sampling

8_14days.text: Symptoms appeared between 8 and 14 days before the sampling

15_28days.text: Symptoms appeared between 15 and 28 days before the sampling

over4w.text: Symptoms appeared more than four weeks before the sampling

dnk.text: I don’t know / don’t want to answer

questions.title: Do you know the result of this rapid antigen detection test?

option_3.text: Yes, the result is non interpretable

option_4.text: No, I don’t know or don’t remember

questions.title: Who performed this rapid antigen test?

option_2.text: A specialized physician, a dental surgeon or a mid-wife

option_3.text: A pharmacist or a pharmacy technician

option_4.comment: (give the list of all health professional authorized to realize this test in your country)

option_5.comment: (give the list of all other professionals authorized to realize this test)

option_6.text: I don’t know or don’t remember

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, did you undergo analyses to know if you have flu?

option_1.text: Yes, a PCR test (virus search, on a nasal swab)

option_2.text: Not yet, I have a prescription and plan to shortly undergo a test

option_3.text: No, I have a prescription but will not undergo the test

questions.title: Do you already get the result of this PCR test?

option_3.text: Yes, the result is non interpretable

option_4.text: No, I do not have the result yet

questions.title: Did you take medication for these symptoms?

option_2.text: Pain killers (e.g. paracetamol, lemsip, ibuprofen, aspirin, calpol, etc)

comment: This is adapted to the UK situation. Other countries will need to adapt the brand names of the commonly used pain killers or antipyretics
Needs to have a check so that participants can’t give inconsistent answers.
Extra country specific options – mapped to “other” in standardised database
rules: [No medication] and [Don’t know] are exclusives to others

questions.title: How much time passed between the beginning of your symptoms did you start taking this medication?
description: Why are we asking this?
Antivirals are thought to be most effective if taken quickly after disease onset.
How should I answer it?
Report the time until  you first started taking antivirals (which may not be the same day as you got your prescription).

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, were you hospitalized?
Did you change your daily routine because of your illness?

option_2.text: Yes, but I did not take time off school or work

option_3.text: Yes, I took time off school or work

description: Why are we asking this?
To measure how people’s daily lives are affected by their symptoms.
How should I answer it?
We want to know if you were absent from work or school as a result of your illness, or if you changed your routine in other ways (e.g. stopped attending clubs).

questions.title: Are you still off work/school?

option_3.text: Other (e.g. I wouldn’t usually be at work/school today anyway

rules: Shown if symptoms and $Q10[Yes, I took time off school or work]

questions.title: How long have you been off work/school?
rules: Shown if symptoms and $Q10[Yes, I took time off school or work]
description: Why are we asking this?
To measure the effect of symptoms on people’s daily lives.
How should I answer it?
Only count the days that you normally would have been in school or work (e.g. don’t count weekends).

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, have you taken or strengthened one or more of the following measures?

option_2.text: Cough or sneeze into your elbow

option_6.text: Stop greeting by hugging and/or kissing on both cheeks

option_7.text: Limit your use of public transport

option_8.text: Avoid gatherings (going to the theater, cinema, stadium, supermarket, etc.)

option_10.text: Telework or increase your number of telework days

option_11.text: Avoid travel outside your own country or region

option_12.text: Have your food/shopping delivered by a store or a friend/family member

option_14.text: Avoid being in contact with people over 65 years old or with a chronic disease

option_15.text: Avoid being in contact with children

rules: Option [None of these measures] is exclusive with other responses

questions.title: Because of your symptoms, have you taken or strengthened one or more of the following measures?
comment: code row12 is reserved to keep compatibility with Qcov7 (none of this measure)

already.text: No, because I was already taking this measure

cough_elbow.text: Cough or sneeze into your elbow

wear_mask_outside.text: Wear a mask (cloth mask or disposable mask) outside my home

wear_mask_inside.text: Wear a mask (cloth mask or disposable mask) inside my home

stop_greeting.text: Stop greeting by hugging and/or kissing on both cheeks

public_transport.text: Limit your use of public transport

gatherings.text: Avoid gatherings (going to the theater, cinema, stadium, supermarket, etc.)

telework.text: Telework or increase your number of telework days

travel.text: Avoid travel outside your own country or region

food-delivery.text: Have your food-shopping delivered by a store or a friend/family member

contact_over65.text: Avoid being in contact with people over 65 years or with a chronic disease

contact_children.text: Avoid being in contact with children

questions.title: What do you think is causing your symptoms?
description: Why are we asking this?

To help find out if our assessment of your illness based on your symptoms matches what you believe to be the cause. You might have a better idea of what is causing your illness than our computer algorithms.
How should I answer it?
If you are reasonably sure about what is causing your symptoms, please tick the appropriate box. Otherwise, please tick “I don’t know”.

questions.title: For which reason(s) do you think you have this disease? (select all the relevant answers)

option_1.text: My doctor told me I have this disease

option_2.text: I had a laboratory confirmation that I have this disease

option_3.text: I had direct contact with a laboratory confirmed case

option_4.text: I had close contact with someone for whom a doctor diagnosed this disease

option_5.text: I was in close contact with someone presenting symptoms of this disease

option_6.text: I was at an event/location with a confirmed case

option_7.text: I think I have this disease

questions.title: Have you informed people who have been in close contact with you about your suspicion of COVID-19 infection?
Since the beginning of COVID-19 lockdown measures, do you carry out a professional activity? (Select all the relevant answers)?

option_3.text: no, I have a leave of absence to take care of my kid(s)

option_4.text: no, I have a sick leave (because of COVID-19)

option_5.text: No, I have another situation (retired, job-seeker, student, house-wife/husband, other sick-leave, partial unemployment, forced leave…)

questions.title: How many days a week do you work outside from home?
Over recent days, at which frequency did you go out of home to buy products, on average?

option_1.text: I do not go out of home anymore

questions.title: Over recent days, at which frequency did you go out of home to get fresh air or exercise (outside your home, balcony, garden, private courtyard), on average?

option_1.text: I do not go out of home anymore

questions.title: Over the course of yesterday, how many people (outside your household) did you approach at a distance lower than 1 meter?
If lockdown measures were lifted up, but collective childcare/schools/university were closed, what would be your situation? (Select all the relevant answers)

option_2.text: I would work from outside home

option_3.text: I would have a leave of absence to take care of my kid(s)

option_4.text: I would have a sick leave (because of COVID-19)

option_5.text: I would be in another situation (retired, job-seeker, student, house-wife/husband, other sick-leave, partial unemployment, forced leave…)

questions.title: How many days a week would you work outside from home?
If lockdown measures were extended (that is to say, continued beyond the date announced by the government), do you think you would follow the recommendations with as much rigour as you do now?
Since January 2020, did you undergo a laboratory test to know if you have been in contact with this new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2, COVID-19)?
What was the result of this (these) analysis? (if you realized several analyses, please give the results of all these analyses)

option_1.text: Positive for this coronavirus, on a swab in nose or mouth, or a sputum or saliva sample (PCR)

option_2.text: Negative for this coronavirus, on a swab in nose or mouth, or a sputum or saliva sample (PCR)

option_3.text: Positive for this coronavirus on a blood sample (serology)

option_4.text: Negative for this coronavirus on a blood sample (serology)

option_5.text: Positive, but I don’t know which test was done (it showed that I was infected by the coronavirus)

option_6.text: Negative, but I don’t know which test was done (it showed that I was not infected by the coronavirus)
